Analyze content "keyword">for Reference Works statistics content_lower = clean_text.lower() print(f"\n--- Analyzing content "keyword">for Reference Works data ---") # Look "keyword">for publication counts "keyword">and statistics "keyword">import re # Patterns "keyword">for Reference Works counts count_patterns = [ r&#x27;(\d{1,4})\s+reference\s+works?', r&#x27;reference\s+works?.*?(\d{1,4})', r&#x27;(\d{1,4})\s+titles?.*?reference', r&#x27;total.*?(\d{1,4}).*?reference\s+works?', r&#x27;(\d{1,4})\s+volumes?.*?reference', r&#x27;published.*?(\d{1,4}).*?reference\s+works?' ] found_counts = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in count_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, content_lower) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: "keyword">if match.isdigit(): count = int(match) "keyword">if 1 <= count <= 5000: # Reasonable range found_counts.append(count) # Look "keyword">for subject area information subject_patterns = [ r&#x27;life\s+sciences?', r&#x27;health\s+sciences?', r&#x27;biomedical', r&#x27;medicine', r&#x27;biology', r&#x27;biochemistry', r&#x27;pharmacology', r&#x27;neuroscience', r&#x27;immunology', r&#x27;genetics' ] subjects_found = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in subject_patterns: "keyword">if re.search(pattern, content_lower): subjects_found.append(pattern.replace(&#x27;\\s+', ' ')) # Look "keyword">for 2022 publication data year_patterns = [ r&#x27;2022', r&#x27;published.*?2022', r&#x27;2022.*?published', r&#x27;"keyword">as\s+of\s+2022' ] has_2022_data = "keyword">False "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: "keyword">if re.search(pattern, content_lower): has_2022_data = "keyword">True "keyword">break # Look "keyword">for browse/navigation elements that might indicate more content navigation_indicators = [ &#x27;browse by subject', &#x27;view all', &#x27;show more', &#x27;filter by', &#x27;subject areas', &#x27;categories' ] has_navigation = [] "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in navigation_indicators: "keyword">if indicator "keyword">in content_lower: has_navigation.append(indicator) print(f"Reference Works counts found: {found_counts}") print(f"Subject areas mentioned: {subjects_found[:5]}") print(f"Has 2022 data: {has_2022_data}") print(f"Navigation elements: {has_navigation[:3]}") # Show content sample print(f"\nContent sample (first 500 characters):") sample_start = max(0, content_lower.find(&#x27;reference') - 100) "keyword">if 'reference' "keyword">in content_lower "keyword">else 0 sample_text = clean_text[sample_start:sample_start+500] print(f"{sample_text}...") successful_accesses.append({ &#x27;name': target['name'], &#x27;url': target['url'], &#x27;filename': filename, &#x27;content_length': len(clean_text), &#x27;reference_works_counts': found_counts, &#x27;subject_areas': subjects_found, &#x27;has_2022_data': has_2022_data, &#x27;navigation_elements': has_navigation, &#x27;status': 'success' }) "keyword">else: print(f"✗ Failed to access (Status: {response.status_code})") successful_accesses.append({ &#x27;name': target['name'], &#x27;url': target['url'], &#x27;status': f'failed_{response.status_code}', &#x27;error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) "keyword">except requests.exceptions.RequestException "keyword">as e: print(f"✗ Request failed: {e}") successful_accesses.append({ &#x27;name': target['name'], &#x27;url': target['url'], &#x27;status': 'error', &#x27;error': str(e) }) print("-" * 70) time.sleep(2) # Be respectful to the server # Analyze all findings print(f"\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF SCIENCEDIRECT REFERENCE WORKS DATA ===\n") all_counts = [] all_subjects = [] sources_with_2022_data = 0 "keyword">for access "keyword">in successful_accesses: "keyword">if access.get(&#x27;status') == 'success': "keyword">if access.get(&#x27;reference_works_counts'): all_counts.extend(access[&#x27;reference_works_counts']) "keyword">if access.get(&#x27;subject_areas'): all_subjects.extend(access[&#x27;subject_areas']) "keyword">if access.get(&#x27;has_2022_data'): sources_with_2022_data += 1 print(f"Sources successfully accessed: {len([a "keyword">for a "keyword">in successful_accesses "keyword">if a.get(&#x27;status') == 'success'])}") print(f"All Reference Works counts found: {sorted(set(all_counts))}") print(f"All subject areas mentioned: {list(set(all_subjects))}") print(f"Sources "keyword">with 2022 data: {sources_with_2022_data}") # Filter reasonable counts reasonable_counts = [count "keyword">for count "keyword">in all_counts "keyword">if 10 <= count <= 2000] "keyword">if reasonable_counts: print(f"\n*** POTENTIAL SCIENCEDIRECT REFERENCE WORKS COUNTS ***") print(f"Reasonable counts found: {sorted(set(reasonable_counts))}") # Find most frequent "keyword">or highest count "keyword">from collections "keyword">import Counter count_frequency = Counter(reasonable_counts) "keyword">if count_frequency: most_common = count_frequency.most_common(1)[0] print(f"Most frequent count: {most_common[0]} (appeared {most_common[1]} times)") print(f"Highest count: {max(reasonable_counts)}") "keyword">else: print(f"\nNo reasonable Reference Works counts found "keyword">in the range 10-2000.") "keyword">if all_counts: print(f"All counts found: {sorted(set(all_counts))}") # Save comprehensive results final_results = { &#x27;search_strategy': 'Direct access to ScienceDirect Reference Works sections', &#x27;target_urls_attempted': len(target_urls), &#x27;successful_accesses': len([a "keyword">for a "keyword">in successful_accesses "keyword">if a.get('status') == 'success']), &#x27;failed_accesses': len([a "keyword">for a "keyword">in successful_accesses "keyword">if a.get('status') != 'success']), &#x27;all_reference_works_counts': sorted(set(all_counts)), &#x27;reasonable_counts': sorted(set(reasonable_counts)), &#x27;subject_areas_found': list(set(all_subjects)), &#x27;sources_with_2022_data': sources_with_2022_data, &#x27;access_details': successful_accesses, &#x27;analysis_timestamp': '2025-01-06', &#x27;focus': 'ScienceDirect Reference Works "keyword">in Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences "keyword">as of 2022' } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;sciencedirect_reference_works_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== INITIAL RESULTS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}") "keyword">if reasonable_counts: highest_count = max(reasonable_counts) print(f"\n🎯 PRELIMINARY FINDINGS: ScienceDirect may have approximately {highest_count} Reference Works") print(f" Focus areas: Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences") print(f" Data source: Direct access to ScienceDirect browse sections") print(f" Year focus: 2022 publication data") "keyword">else: print(f"\n⚠️ No definitive Reference Works counts found "keyword">in initial access") print(f" Next steps: Analyze downloaded content "keyword">in detail") print(f" Alternative: Search ScienceDirect&#x27;s advanced search "keyword">or statistics pages") print(f"\nWorkspace files created:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): "keyword">if &#x27;sciencedirect' "keyword">in file: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") print(f"\n=== NEXT STEPS ===\n") print(f"1. Analyze downloaded ScienceDirect content "keyword">for detailed Reference Works statistics") print(f"2. Look "keyword">for subject-specific breakdowns "keyword">in Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences") print(f"3. Search "keyword">for publication year filters "keyword">or 2022-specific data") print(f"4. Extract comprehensive publication counts by domain type")
📄 Output

📝 Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import time print("=== ALTERNATIVE APPROACH: ACCESSING SCIENCEDIRECT WITH DIFFERENT STRATEGY ===\n") # Find workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using existing workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) print(f"Created workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") # First, let's inspect the previous results file to understand what happened print("\n=== INSPECTING PREVIOUS RESULTS ===\n") results_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if &#x27;sciencedirect' "keyword">in f "keyword">and f.endswith('.json')] "keyword">if results_files: results_file = results_files[0] print(f"Found previous results file: {results_file}") # Inspect the structure first "keyword">with open(os.path.join(workspace_dir, results_file), &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: "keyword">try: previous_results = json.load(f) print(f"Previous results structure:") "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in previous_results.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items") "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys") "keyword">else: print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {value}") "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f"Error reading previous results: {e}") "keyword">else: print("No previous results file found") print("\n=== TRYING ALTERNATIVE SCIENCEDIRECT ACCESS METHODS ===\n") # Updated headers "keyword">with more realistic browser simulation headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/avif,image/webp,image/apng,*/*;q=0.8,application/signed-exchange;v=b3;q=0.7', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9', &#x27;Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', &#x27;DNT': '1', &#x27;Connection': 'keep-alive', &#x27;Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1', &#x27;Sec-Fetch-Dest': 'document', &#x27;Sec-Fetch-Mode': 'navigate', &#x27;Sec-Fetch-Site': 'none', &#x27;Cache-Control': 'max-age=0' } # Try simpler, more basic ScienceDirect URLs first alternative_urls = [ { &#x27;name': 'ScienceDirect Main Page', &#x27;url': 'https://www.sciencedirect.com/', &#x27;description': 'Test basic connectivity to ScienceDirect' }, { &#x27;name': 'ScienceDirect Browse', &#x27;url': 'https://www.sciencedirect.com/browse', &#x27;description': 'Main browse page to understand structure' }, { &#x27;name': 'ScienceDirect Search', &#x27;url': 'https://www.sciencedirect.com/search', &#x27;description': 'Search page to understand available options' }, { &#x27;name': 'ScienceDirect Reference Works Simple Search', &#x27;url': 'https://www.sciencedirect.com/search?qs=reference%20works', &#x27;description': 'Simple search "keyword">for reference works without year filter' }, { &#x27;name': 'ScienceDirect Life Sciences Search', &#x27;url': 'https://www.sciencedirect.com/search?qs=life%20sciences', &#x27;description': 'Search "keyword">for life sciences content' } ] successful_accesses = [] "keyword">for i, target "keyword">in enumerate(alternative_urls, 1): print(f"Attempting {i}. {target[&#x27;name']}") print(f"URL: {target[&#x27;url']}") print(f"Purpose: {target[&#x27;description']}") "keyword">try: # Use session "keyword">for better connection handling session = requests.Session() session.headers.update(headers) response = session.get(target[&#x27;url'], timeout=30, allow_redirects="keyword">True) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") print(f"Final URL after redirects: {response.url}") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: print(f"✓ Successfully accessed!") # Parse the content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Remove script "keyword">and style elements "keyword">for script "keyword">in soup(["script", "style"]): script.decompose() # Get text content text = soup.get_text() # Clean up text lines = (line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in text.splitlines()) chunks = (phrase.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines "keyword">for phrase "keyword">in line.split(" ")) clean_text = &#x27; '.join(chunk "keyword">for chunk "keyword">in chunks "keyword">if chunk) # Save the content filename = f"sciencedirect_alternative_{i}_{target[&#x27;name'].replace(' ', '_').replace('/', '_')[:40]}.txt" filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) "keyword">with open(filepath, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"Source: {target[&#x27;name']}\n") f.write(f"URL: {target[&#x27;url']}\n") f.write(f"Final URL: {response.url}\n") f.write(f"Purpose: {target[&#x27;description']}\n") f.write(f"Status: {response.status_code}\n") f.write(f"Content Length: {len(clean_text):,} characters\n") f.write("=" * 50 + "\n") f.write(clean_text) print(f"Content saved to: {filename}") print(f"Text length: {len(clean_text):,} characters") # Quick analysis "keyword">for relevant content content_lower = clean_text.lower() # Look "keyword">for reference works mentions reference_works_mentions = content_lower.count(&#x27;reference works') reference_mentions = content_lower.count(&#x27;reference') life_sciences_mentions = content_lower.count(&#x27;life sciences') health_sciences_mentions = content_lower.count(&#x27;health sciences') print(f"\n--- Quick Content Analysis ---") print(f"&#x27;Reference works' mentions: {reference_works_mentions}") print(f"&#x27;Reference' mentions: {reference_mentions}") print(f"&#x27;Life sciences' mentions: {life_sciences_mentions}") print(f"&#x27;Health sciences' mentions: {health_sciences_mentions}") # Look "keyword">for navigation "keyword">or browse elements browse_indicators = [&#x27;browse by', 'subject areas', 'categories', 'filter', 'search results'] found_indicators = [] "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in browse_indicators: "keyword">if indicator "keyword">in content_lower: found_indicators.append(indicator) print(f"Browse/navigation indicators: {found_indicators[:3]}") # Show a sample of content print(f"\nContent sample (first 400 characters):") sample_text = clean_text[:400] print(f"{sample_text}...") successful_accesses.append({ &#x27;name': target['name'], &#x27;url': target['url'], &#x27;final_url': response.url, &#x27;filename': filename, &#x27;content_length': len(clean_text), &#x27;reference_works_mentions': reference_works_mentions, &#x27;reference_mentions': reference_mentions, &#x27;life_sciences_mentions': life_sciences_mentions, &#x27;health_sciences_mentions': health_sciences_mentions, &#x27;browse_indicators': found_indicators, &#x27;status': 'success' }) "keyword">else: print(f"✗ Failed to access (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"Response headers: {dict(response.headers)}") successful_accesses.append({ &#x27;name': target['name'], &#x27;url': target['url'], &#x27;final_url': response.url, &#x27;status': f'failed_{response.status_code}', &#x27;error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}', &#x27;response_headers': dict(response.headers) }) "keyword">except requests.exceptions.RequestException "keyword">as e: print(f"✗ Request failed: {e}") successful_accesses.append({ &#x27;name': target['name'], &#x27;url': target['url'], &#x27;status': 'error', &#x27;error': str(e) }) print("-" * 70) time.sleep(3) # Be more respectful to the server # Analyze results print(f"\n=== ALTERNATIVE ACCESS RESULTS ANALYSIS ===\n") successful_count = len([a "keyword">for a "keyword">in successful_accesses "keyword">if a.get(&#x27;status') == 'success']) failed_count = len(successful_accesses) - successful_count print(f"Successful accesses: {successful_count}") print(f"Failed accesses: {failed_count}") "keyword">if successful_count > 0: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING SUCCESSFULLY ACCESSED CONTENT ===\n") total_reference_works = 0 total_references = 0 total_life_sciences = 0 total_health_sciences = 0 all_browse_indicators = [] "keyword">for access "keyword">in successful_accesses: "keyword">if access.get(&#x27;status') == 'success': total_reference_works += access.get(&#x27;reference_works_mentions', 0) total_references += access.get(&#x27;reference_mentions', 0) total_life_sciences += access.get(&#x27;life_sciences_mentions', 0) total_health_sciences += access.get(&#x27;health_sciences_mentions', 0) all_browse_indicators.extend(access.get(&#x27;browse_indicators', [])) print(f"Total &#x27;reference works' mentions across all pages: {total_reference_works}") print(f"Total &#x27;reference' mentions across all pages: {total_references}") print(f"Total &#x27;life sciences' mentions across all pages: {total_life_sciences}") print(f"Total &#x27;health sciences' mentions across all pages: {total_health_sciences}") print(f"All browse indicators found: {list(set(all_browse_indicators))}") # Identify most promising sources "keyword">for detailed analysis promising_sources = [] "keyword">for access "keyword">in successful_accesses: "keyword">if access.get(&#x27;status') == 'success': score = 0 score += access.get(&#x27;reference_works_mentions', 0) * 3 score += access.get(&#x27;life_sciences_mentions', 0) * 2 score += access.get(&#x27;health_sciences_mentions', 0) * 2 score += len(access.get(&#x27;browse_indicators', [])) * 1 "keyword">if score > 0: promising_sources.append((access, score)) promising_sources.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[1], reverse="keyword">True) print(f"\n=== MOST PROMISING SOURCES FOR DETAILED ANALYSIS ===\n") "keyword">for i, (source, score) "keyword">in enumerate(promising_sources[:3], 1): print(f"{i}. {source[&#x27;name']} (Score: {score})") print(f" File: {source[&#x27;filename']}") print(f" Reference works mentions: {source.get(&#x27;reference_works_mentions', 0)}") print(f" Life sciences mentions: {source.get(&#x27;life_sciences_mentions', 0)}") print(f" Health sciences mentions: {source.get(&#x27;health_sciences_mentions', 0)}") print() "keyword">else: print(f"\n⚠️ No successful accesses to ScienceDirect") print(f"All attempted URLs failed. This suggests:") print(f"1. ScienceDirect may be blocking automated access") print(f"2. URLs may require authentication "keyword">or subscription") print(f"3. Network connectivity issues") print(f"4. ScienceDirect may have changed their URL structure") # Save updated results updated_results = { &#x27;search_strategy': 'Alternative ScienceDirect access "keyword">with improved headers "keyword">and simpler URLs', &#x27;target_urls_attempted': len(alternative_urls), &#x27;successful_accesses': successful_count, &#x27;failed_accesses': failed_count, &#x27;access_details': successful_accesses, &#x27;analysis_timestamp': '2025-01-06', &#x27;focus': 'ScienceDirect Reference Works "keyword">in Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences', &#x27;next_steps': [ &#x27;Analyze downloaded content "keyword">for Reference Works statistics', &#x27;Look "keyword">for alternative data sources "keyword">if ScienceDirect access continues to fail', &#x27;Consider using academic databases "keyword">or publisher APIs', &#x27;Search "keyword">for Elsevier/ScienceDirect annual reports "keyword">or statistics' ] } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;sciencedirect_alternative_access.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(updated_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== UPDATED RESULTS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Updated analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}") print(f"\nWorkspace files:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") "keyword">if successful_count > 0: print(f"\n✓ SUCCESS: Accessed {successful_count} ScienceDirect pages") print(f"Next: Analyze downloaded content "keyword">for Reference Works statistics") "keyword">else: print(f"\n⚠️ ALTERNATIVE APPROACH NEEDED") print(f"Consider searching "keyword">for:") print(f"1. Elsevier annual reports "keyword">with ScienceDirect statistics") print(f"2. Academic library databases "keyword">with Reference Works counts") print(f"3. Publisher websites "keyword">with Reference Works catalogs") print(f"4. Research databases that index Reference Works publications")
📄 Output

📝 Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import time print("=== ALTERNATIVE APPROACH: ACCESSING SCIENCEDIRECT WITH DIFFERENT STRATEGY ===\n") # Find workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using existing workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) print(f"Created workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") # First, let's inspect the previous results file to understand what happened print("\n=== INSPECTING PREVIOUS RESULTS ===\n") results_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if &#x27;sciencedirect' "keyword">in f "keyword">and f.endswith('.json')] "keyword">if results_files: results_file = results_files[0] print(f"Found previous results file: {results_file}") # Inspect the structure first "keyword">with open(os.path.join(workspace_dir, results_file), &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: "keyword">try: previous_results = json.load(f) print(f"Previous results structure:") "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in previous_results.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items") "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys") "keyword">else: print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {value}") "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f"Error reading previous results: {e}") "keyword">else: print("No previous results file found") print("\n=== TRYING ALTERNATIVE SCIENCEDIRECT ACCESS METHODS ===\n") # Updated headers "keyword">with more realistic browser simulation headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/avif,image/webp,image/apng,*/*;q=0.8,application/signed-exchange;v=b3;q=0.7', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9', &#x27;Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', &#x27;DNT': '1', &#x27;Connection': 'keep-alive', &#x27;Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1', &#x27;Sec-Fetch-Dest': 'document', &#x27;Sec-Fetch-Mode': 'navigate', &#x27;Sec-Fetch-Site': 'none', &#x27;Cache-Control': 'max-age=0' } # Try simpler, more basic ScienceDirect URLs first alternative_urls = [ { &#x27;name': 'ScienceDirect Main Page', &#x27;url': 'https://www.sciencedirect.com/', &#x27;description': 'Test basic connectivity to ScienceDirect' }, { &#x27;name': 'ScienceDirect Browse', &#x27;url': 'https://www.sciencedirect.com/browse', &#x27;description': 'Main browse page to understand structure' }, { &#x27;name': 'ScienceDirect Search', &#x27;url': 'https://www.sciencedirect.com/search', &#x27;description': 'Search page to understand available options' }, { &#x27;name': 'ScienceDirect Reference Works Simple Search', &#x27;url': 'https://www.sciencedirect.com/search?qs=reference%20works', &#x27;description': 'Simple search "keyword">for reference works without year filter' }, { &#x27;name': 'ScienceDirect Life Sciences Search', &#x27;url': 'https://www.sciencedirect.com/search?qs=life%20sciences', &#x27;description': 'Search "keyword">for life sciences content' } ] successful_accesses = [] "keyword">for i, target "keyword">in enumerate(alternative_urls, 1): print(f"Attempting {i}. {target[&#x27;name']}") print(f"URL: {target[&#x27;url']}") print(f"Purpose: {target[&#x27;description']}") "keyword">try: # Use session "keyword">for better connection handling session = requests.Session() session.headers.update(headers) response = session.get(target[&#x27;url'], timeout=30, allow_redirects="keyword">True) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") print(f"Final URL after redirects: {response.url}") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: print(f"✓ Successfully accessed!") # Parse the content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Remove script "keyword">and style elements "keyword">for script "keyword">in soup(["script", "style"]): script.decompose() # Get text content text = soup.get_text() # Clean up text lines = (line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in text.splitlines()) chunks = (phrase.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines "keyword">for phrase "keyword">in line.split(" ")) clean_text = &#x27; '.join(chunk "keyword">for chunk "keyword">in chunks "keyword">if chunk) # Save the content filename = f"sciencedirect_alternative_{i}_{target[&#x27;name'].replace(' ', '_').replace('/', '_')[:40]}.txt" filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) "keyword">with open(filepath, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"Source: {target[&#x27;name']}\n") f.write(f"URL: {target[&#x27;url']}\n") f.write(f"Final URL: {response.url}\n") f.write(f"Purpose: {target[&#x27;description']}\n") f.write(f"Status: {response.status_code}\n") f.write(f"Content Length: {len(clean_text):,} characters\n") f.write("=" * 50 + "\n") f.write(clean_text) print(f"Content saved to: {filename}") print(f"Text length: {len(clean_text):,} characters") # Quick analysis "keyword">for relevant content content_lower = clean_text.lower() # Look "keyword">for reference works mentions reference_works_mentions = content_lower.count(&#x27;reference works') reference_mentions = content_lower.count(&#x27;reference') life_sciences_mentions = content_lower.count(&#x27;life sciences') health_sciences_mentions = content_lower.count(&#x27;health sciences') print(f"\n--- Quick Content Analysis ---") print(f"&#x27;Reference works' mentions: {reference_works_mentions}") print(f"&#x27;Reference' mentions: {reference_mentions}") print(f"&#x27;Life sciences' mentions: {life_sciences_mentions}") print(f"&#x27;Health sciences' mentions: {health_sciences_mentions}") # Look "keyword">for navigation "keyword">or browse elements browse_indicators = [&#x27;browse by', 'subject areas', 'categories', 'filter', 'search results'] found_indicators = [] "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in browse_indicators: "keyword">if indicator "keyword">in content_lower: found_indicators.append(indicator) print(f"Browse/navigation indicators: {found_indicators[:3]}") # Show a sample of content print(f"\nContent sample (first 400 characters):") sample_text = clean_text[:400] print(f"{sample_text}...") successful_accesses.append({ &#x27;name': target['name'], &#x27;url': target['url'], &#x27;final_url': response.url, &#x27;filename': filename, &#x27;content_length': len(clean_text), &#x27;reference_works_mentions': reference_works_mentions, &#x27;reference_mentions': reference_mentions, &#x27;life_sciences_mentions': life_sciences_mentions, &#x27;health_sciences_mentions': health_sciences_mentions, &#x27;browse_indicators': found_indicators, &#x27;status': 'success' }) "keyword">else: print(f"✗ Failed to access (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"Response headers: {dict(response.headers)}") successful_accesses.append({ &#x27;name': target['name'], &#x27;url': target['url'], &#x27;final_url': response.url, &#x27;status': f'failed_{response.status_code}', &#x27;error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}', &#x27;response_headers': dict(response.headers) }) "keyword">except requests.exceptions.RequestException "keyword">as e: print(f"✗ Request failed: {e}") successful_accesses.append({ &#x27;name': target['name'], &#x27;url': target['url'], &#x27;status': 'error', &#x27;error': str(e) }) print("-" * 70) time.sleep(3) # Be more respectful to the server # Analyze results print(f"\n=== ALTERNATIVE ACCESS RESULTS ANALYSIS ===\n") successful_count = len([a "keyword">for a "keyword">in successful_accesses "keyword">if a.get(&#x27;status') == 'success']) failed_count = len(successful_accesses) - successful_count print(f"Successful accesses: {successful_count}") print(f"Failed accesses: {failed_count}") "keyword">if successful_count > 0: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING SUCCESSFULLY ACCESSED CONTENT ===\n") total_reference_works = 0 total_references = 0 total_life_sciences = 0 total_health_sciences = 0 all_browse_indicators = [] "keyword">for access "keyword">in successful_accesses: "keyword">if access.get(&#x27;status') == 'success': total_reference_works += access.get(&#x27;reference_works_mentions', 0) total_references += access.get(&#x27;reference_mentions', 0) total_life_sciences += access.get(&#x27;life_sciences_mentions', 0) total_health_sciences += access.get(&#x27;health_sciences_mentions', 0) all_browse_indicators.extend(access.get(&#x27;browse_indicators', [])) print(f"Total &#x27;reference works' mentions across all pages: {total_reference_works}") print(f"Total &#x27;reference' mentions across all pages: {total_references}") print(f"Total &#x27;life sciences' mentions across all pages: {total_life_sciences}") print(f"Total &#x27;health sciences' mentions across all pages: {total_health_sciences}") print(f"All browse indicators found: {list(set(all_browse_indicators))}") # Identify most promising sources "keyword">for detailed analysis promising_sources = [] "keyword">for access "keyword">in successful_accesses: "keyword">if access.get(&#x27;status') == 'success': score = 0 score += access.get(&#x27;reference_works_mentions', 0) * 3 score += access.get(&#x27;life_sciences_mentions', 0) * 2 score += access.get(&#x27;health_sciences_mentions', 0) * 2 score += len(access.get(&#x27;browse_indicators', [])) * 1 "keyword">if score > 0: promising_sources.append((access, score)) promising_sources.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[1], reverse="keyword">True) print(f"\n=== MOST PROMISING SOURCES FOR DETAILED ANALYSIS ===\n") "keyword">for i, (source, score) "keyword">in enumerate(promising_sources[:3], 1): print(f"{i}. {source[&#x27;name']} (Score: {score})") print(f" File: {source[&#x27;filename']}") print(f" Reference works mentions: {source.get(&#x27;reference_works_mentions', 0)}") print(f" Life sciences mentions: {source.get(&#x27;life_sciences_mentions', 0)}") print(f" Health sciences mentions: {source.get(&#x27;health_sciences_mentions', 0)}") print() "keyword">else: print(f"\n⚠️ No successful accesses to ScienceDirect") print(f"All attempted URLs failed. This suggests:") print(f"1. ScienceDirect may be blocking automated access") print(f"2. URLs may require authentication "keyword">or subscription") print(f"3. Network connectivity issues") print(f"4. ScienceDirect may have changed their URL structure") # Save updated results updated_results = { &#x27;search_strategy': 'Alternative ScienceDirect access "keyword">with improved headers "keyword">and simpler URLs', &#x27;target_urls_attempted': len(alternative_urls), &#x27;successful_accesses': successful_count, &#x27;failed_accesses': failed_count, &#x27;access_details': successful_accesses, &#x27;analysis_timestamp': '2025-01-06', &#x27;focus': 'ScienceDirect Reference Works "keyword">in Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences', &#x27;next_steps': [ &#x27;Analyze downloaded content "keyword">for Reference Works statistics', &#x27;Look "keyword">for alternative data sources "keyword">if ScienceDirect access continues to fail', &#x27;Consider using academic databases "keyword">or publisher APIs', &#x27;Search "keyword">for Elsevier/ScienceDirect annual reports "keyword">or statistics' ] } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;sciencedirect_alternative_access.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(updated_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== UPDATED RESULTS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Updated analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}") print(f"\nWorkspace files:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") "keyword">if successful_count > 0: print(f"\n✓ SUCCESS: Accessed {successful_count} ScienceDirect pages") print(f"Next: Analyze downloaded content "keyword">for Reference Works statistics") "keyword">else: print(f"\n⚠️ ALTERNATIVE APPROACH NEEDED") print(f"Consider searching "keyword">for:") print(f"1. Elsevier annual reports "keyword">with ScienceDirect statistics") print(f"2. Academic library databases "keyword">with Reference Works counts") print(f"3. Publisher websites "keyword">with Reference Works catalogs") print(f"4. Research databases that index Reference Works publications")

developer Code Execution - Plan 01 (Iteration 3)
2025-08-11 06:10:30

📝 Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import re print("=== DETAILED ANALYSIS OF DOWNLOADED SCIENCEDIRECT CONTENT FOR REFERENCE WORKS DATA ===\n") # Find workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found.") exit() # First, inspect the structure of downloaded files print(f"\nFiles "keyword">in workspace:") sciencedirect_files = [] "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") "keyword">if &#x27;sciencedirect_alternative' "keyword">in file "keyword">and file.endswith('.txt'): sciencedirect_files.append(file) print(f"\nFound {len(sciencedirect_files)} ScienceDirect content files to analyze:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in sciencedirect_files: print(f" - {file}") print("\n=== DETAILED CONTENT ANALYSIS FOR REFERENCE WORKS INFORMATION ===\n") # Analyze each downloaded ScienceDirect file "keyword">in detail analysis_results = [] "keyword">for i, filename "keyword">in enumerate(sciencedirect_files, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) print(f"Analyzing {i}. {filename}") "keyword">with open(filepath, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() print(f"Content length: {len(content):,} characters") # Extract header information lines = content.split(&#x27;\n') header_info = {} "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines[:10]: "keyword">if line.startswith(&#x27;Source:'): header_info[&#x27;source'] = line.replace('Source:', '').strip() "keyword">elif line.startswith(&#x27;URL:'): header_info[&#x27;url'] = line.replace('URL:', '').strip() "keyword">elif line.startswith(&#x27;Final URL:'): header_info[&#x27;final_url'] = line.replace('Final URL:', '').strip() print(f"Source: {header_info.get(&#x27;source', 'Unknown')}") print(f"Original URL: {header_info.get(&#x27;url', 'Unknown')}") print(f"Final URL: {header_info.get(&#x27;final_url', 'Unknown')}") # Extract main content after header content_start_marker = "=" * 50 "keyword">if content_start_marker "keyword">in content: main_content = content[content.find(content_start_marker) + len(content_start_marker):] "keyword">else: main_content = content[500:] # Skip header info print(f"Main content length: {len(main_content):,} characters") # Convert to lowercase "keyword">for analysis content_lower = main_content.lower() print(f"\n--- Comprehensive Reference Works Search ---") # Expanded patterns "keyword">for Reference Works "keyword">and related content reference_patterns = [ r&#x27;reference\s+works?', r&#x27;reference\s+book', r&#x27;reference\s+collection', r&#x27;handbook', r&#x27;encyclopedia', r&#x27;comprehensive\s+reference', r&#x27;reference\s+module', r&#x27;reference\s+series', r&#x27;multi-volume\s+reference', r&#x27;reference\s+publication' ] reference_matches = {} total_reference_indicators = 0 "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in reference_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, content_lower) "keyword">if matches: reference_matches[pattern] = len(matches) total_reference_indicators += len(matches) print(f"Reference Works patterns found:") "keyword">for pattern, count "keyword">in reference_matches.items(): print(f" {pattern}: {count} occurrences") print(f"Total reference indicators: {total_reference_indicators}") # Look "keyword">for subject area classifications print(f"\n--- Subject Area Analysis ---") life_science_terms = [ &#x27;life sciences', 'life science', 'biology', 'biochemistry', 'biophysics', &#x27;molecular biology', 'cell biology', 'genetics', 'genomics', 'proteomics', &#x27;biotechnology', 'microbiology', 'ecology', 'evolution', 'botany', &#x27;zoology', 'marine biology', 'environmental science' ] health_science_terms = [ &#x27;health sciences', 'health science', 'medicine', 'medical', 'clinical', &#x27;pharmacology', 'pharmacy', 'nursing', 'public health', 'epidemiology', &#x27;immunology', 'pathology', 'physiology', 'anatomy', 'neuroscience', &#x27;cardiology', 'oncology', 'psychiatry', 'radiology', 'surgery' ] life_science_counts = {} health_science_counts = {} "keyword">for term "keyword">in life_science_terms: count = content_lower.count(term) "keyword">if count > 0: life_science_counts[term] = count "keyword">for term "keyword">in health_science_terms: count = content_lower.count(term) "keyword">if count > 0: health_science_counts[term] = count print(f"Life Science terms found: {life_science_counts}") print(f"Health Science terms found: {health_science_counts}") # Look "keyword">for publication statistics "keyword">or counts print(f"\n--- Publication Statistics Search ---") # Patterns that might indicate publication counts count_patterns = [ r&#x27;(\d{1,5})\s+(?:books?|titles?|volumes?|publications?)', r&#x27;(\d{1,5})\s+(?:reference\s+works?|handbooks?|encyclopedias?)', r&#x27;over\s+(\d{1,5})\s+(?:books?|titles?|publications?)', r&#x27;more\s+than\s+(\d{1,5})\s+(?:books?|titles?)', r&#x27;(\d{1,5})\s+(?:scientific|academic)\s+(?:books?|publications?)', r&#x27;collection\s+of\s+(\d{1,5})\s+(?:books?|titles?)', r&#x27;(\d{1,5})\s+(?:journals?\s+"keyword">and\s+books?|books?\s+"keyword">and\s+journals?)' ] found_counts = [] count_details = {} "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in count_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, content_lower) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: "keyword">if match.isdigit(): count = int(match) "keyword">if 10 <= count <= 50000: # Reasonable range "keyword">for publication counts found_counts.append(count) "keyword">if pattern "keyword">not "keyword">in count_details: count_details[pattern] = [] count_details[pattern].append(count) print(f"Publication counts found: {sorted(set(found_counts))}") "keyword">for pattern, counts "keyword">in count_details.items(): print(f" {pattern}: {counts}") # Look "keyword">for 2022 "keyword">or recent year mentions print(f"\n--- Year "keyword">and Date Analysis ---") year_patterns = [ r&#x27;2022', r'2021', r'2023', r'2020', r&#x27;"keyword">as\s+of\s+\d{4}', r&#x27;published\s+"keyword">in\s+\d{4}', r&#x27;updated\s+\d{4}' ] year_mentions = {} "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, content_lower) "keyword">if matches: year_mentions[pattern] = len(matches) print(f"Year mentions: {year_mentions}") # Look "keyword">for browse/navigation structure that might lead to more detailed data print(f"\n--- Navigation "keyword">and Structure Analysis ---") navigation_patterns = [ r&#x27;browse\s+by\s+subject', r&#x27;subject\s+areas?', r&#x27;browse\s+(?:books?|journals?)', r&#x27;filter\s+by', r&#x27;search\s+results?', r&#x27;view\s+all', r&#x27;show\s+more', r&#x27;categories?', r&#x27;disciplines?' ] navigation_found = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in navigation_patterns: "keyword">if re.search(pattern, content_lower): navigation_found.append(pattern.replace(&#x27;\\s+', ' ')) print(f"Navigation elements found: {navigation_found}") # Show relevant content samples print(f"\n--- Content Samples ---") # Find sections mentioning reference, books, "keyword">or publications reference_contexts = [] words = main_content.split() "keyword">for i, word "keyword">in enumerate(words): "keyword">if any(term "keyword">in word.lower() "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;reference', 'book', 'handbook', 'encyclopedia']): start = max(0, i-10) end = min(len(words), i+10) context = &#x27; '.join(words[start:end]) reference_contexts.append(context) # Show first few contexts "keyword">for j, context "keyword">in enumerate(reference_contexts[:3]): print(f"Context {j+1}: {context}") # Save detailed analysis "keyword">for this file file_analysis = { &#x27;filename': filename, &#x27;source': header_info.get('source', 'Unknown'), &#x27;original_url': header_info.get('url', 'Unknown'), &#x27;final_url': header_info.get('final_url', 'Unknown'), &#x27;content_length': len(content), &#x27;main_content_length': len(main_content), &#x27;reference_patterns': reference_matches, &#x27;total_reference_indicators': total_reference_indicators, &#x27;life_science_terms': life_science_counts, &#x27;health_science_terms': health_science_counts, &#x27;publication_counts': sorted(set(found_counts)), &#x27;count_details': count_details, &#x27;year_mentions': year_mentions, &#x27;navigation_elements': navigation_found, &#x27;reference_contexts': reference_contexts[:5] # Save first 5 contexts } analysis_results.append(file_analysis) print("=" * 80) # Comprehensive analysis across all files print(f"\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS ACROSS ALL SCIENCEDIRECT FILES ===\n") all_reference_indicators = 0 all_publication_counts = [] all_life_science_terms = {} all_health_science_terms = {} all_navigation_elements = [] "keyword">for result "keyword">in analysis_results: all_reference_indicators += result[&#x27;total_reference_indicators'] all_publication_counts.extend(result[&#x27;publication_counts']) # Combine life science terms "keyword">for term, count "keyword">in result[&#x27;life_science_terms'].items(): all_life_science_terms[term] = all_life_science_terms.get(term, 0) + count # Combine health science terms "keyword">for term, count "keyword">in result[&#x27;health_science_terms'].items(): all_health_science_terms[term] = all_health_science_terms.get(term, 0) + count all_navigation_elements.extend(result[&#x27;navigation_elements']) print(f"Files analyzed: {len(analysis_results)}") print(f"Total reference indicators across all files: {all_reference_indicators}") print(f"All publication counts found: {sorted(set(all_publication_counts))}") print(f"Life Science terms (combined): {dict(sorted(all_life_science_terms.items(), key="keyword">lambda x: x[1], reverse="keyword">True))}") print(f"Health Science terms (combined): {dict(sorted(all_health_science_terms.items(), key="keyword">lambda x: x[1], reverse="keyword">True))}") print(f"Navigation elements found: {list(set(all_navigation_elements))}") # Determine "keyword">if we found useful Reference Works data print(f"\n=== ASSESSMENT OF REFERENCE WORKS DATA AVAILABILITY ===\n") "keyword">if all_reference_indicators > 0: print(f"✓ Found {all_reference_indicators} reference-related indicators") "keyword">else: print(f"✗ No specific reference works indicators found") "keyword">if all_publication_counts: print(f"✓ Found publication counts: {sorted(set(all_publication_counts))}") print(f" Largest count: {max(all_publication_counts)}") print(f" Most frequent counts: {sorted(set(all_publication_counts))}") "keyword">else: print(f"✗ No publication counts found") "keyword">if all_life_science_terms "keyword">or all_health_science_terms: print(f"✓ Found subject area terms indicating Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences content") total_life_mentions = sum(all_life_science_terms.values()) total_health_mentions = sum(all_health_science_terms.values()) print(f" Total Life Sciences mentions: {total_life_mentions}") print(f" Total Health Sciences mentions: {total_health_mentions}") "keyword">else: print(f"✗ Limited subject area information found") # Final assessment "keyword">and recommendations print(f"\n=== FINAL ASSESSMENT AND RECOMMENDATIONS ===\n") "keyword">if all_publication_counts "keyword">and (all_life_science_terms "keyword">or all_health_science_terms): # We found some relevant data highest_count = max(all_publication_counts) print(f"🎯 PARTIAL SUCCESS: Found publication data "keyword">from ScienceDirect") print(f" Highest publication count found: {highest_count}") print(f" Subject areas confirmed: Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences present") print(f" Limitation: Specific &#x27;Reference Works' classification "keyword">not clearly identified") print(f" Interpretation: The {highest_count} may represent total books/publications including Reference Works") "keyword">elif all_navigation_elements: print(f"📍 NAVIGATION FOUND: ScienceDirect structure identified") print(f" Navigation elements: {list(set(all_navigation_elements))}") print(f" Recommendation: Use navigation to access more specific Reference Works sections") "keyword">else: print(f"⚠️ LIMITED DATA: Downloaded content lacks specific Reference Works statistics") print(f" Possible reasons:") print(f" 1. ScienceDirect may require authentication to view detailed statistics") print(f" 2. Reference Works data may be "keyword">in different sections "keyword">not yet accessed") print(f" 3. Data may be presented "keyword">in JavaScript-rendered content "keyword">not captured") print(f"\n=== ALTERNATIVE DATA SOURCE RECOMMENDATIONS ===\n") print(f"Since specific Reference Works counts are "keyword">not clearly available "keyword">from the accessed pages:") print(f"1. Search "keyword">for Elsevier annual reports "keyword">or ScienceDirect statistics publications") print(f"2. Look "keyword">for academic library databases that catalog Reference Works by publisher") print(f"3. Search "keyword">for bibliometric studies on Reference Works "keyword">in Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences") print(f"4. Contact Elsevier directly "keyword">for Reference Works publication statistics") print(f"5. Use alternative academic databases (Web of Science, Scopus) that may have this data") # Save comprehensive final analysis final_comprehensive_analysis = { &#x27;analysis_date': '2025-01-06', &#x27;method': 'Detailed content analysis of downloaded ScienceDirect pages', &#x27;files_analyzed': len(analysis_results), &#x27;total_reference_indicators': all_reference_indicators, &#x27;publication_counts_found': sorted(set(all_publication_counts)), &#x27;life_science_terms_total': sum(all_life_science_terms.values()), &#x27;health_science_terms_total': sum(all_health_science_terms.values()), &#x27;navigation_elements': list(set(all_navigation_elements)), &#x27;file_details': analysis_results, &#x27;assessment': { &#x27;reference_works_data_found': all_reference_indicators > 0, &#x27;publication_counts_available': len(all_publication_counts) > 0, &#x27;subject_areas_confirmed': len(all_life_science_terms) > 0 "keyword">or len(all_health_science_terms) > 0, &#x27;highest_publication_count': max(all_publication_counts) "keyword">if all_publication_counts "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;data_completeness': 'Partial' "keyword">if all_publication_counts "keyword">else 'Limited' }, &#x27;recommendations': [ &#x27;Search Elsevier annual reports "keyword">for Reference Works statistics', &#x27;Use academic databases "keyword">for Reference Works cataloging', &#x27;Contact publisher directly "keyword">for specific data', &#x27;Try bibliometric databases "keyword">for Reference Works analysis' ] } final_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;sciencedirect_reference_works_detailed_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(final_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_comprehensive_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\nDetailed analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(final_file)}") print(f"\nWorkspace files:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): "keyword">if &#x27;sciencedirect' "keyword">in file: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")

tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 06:10:30

Execution successful - Code ran without errors and performed comprehensive analysis of all 5 downloaded ScienceDirect content files. The detailed analysis extracted extensive information including reference patterns, subject area terms, publication counts, and navigation elements. Key findings: (1) Found one publication count of 145 from the browse page, (2) Confirmed presence of Life Sciences (22 mentions) and Health Sciences (33 mentions) content, (3) Identified that 4 out of 5 files redirected to authentication pages limiting content access, (4) No specific 'Reference Works' indicators found despite thorough pattern matching. The code successfully saved a comprehensive analysis to 'sciencedirect_reference_works_detailed_analysis.json' (9,160 bytes) containing all findings and recommendations. **PLAN** alignment: 40% - ScienceDirect data was successfully analyzed but specific Reference Works statistics for 2022 were not found in the accessible content. The analysis correctly identifies that authentication barriers prevented access to detailed Reference Works sections and provides practical alternative recommendations including searching Elsevier annual reports, academic library databases, and bibliometric studies. The **PLAN** objective requires more targeted data sources since ScienceDirect's public pages don't contain the specific Reference Works counts needed.

📝 Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import re print("=== DETAILED ANALYSIS OF DOWNLOADED SCIENCEDIRECT CONTENT FOR REFERENCE WORKS DATA ===\n") # Find workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found.") exit() # First, inspect the structure of downloaded files print(f"\nFiles "keyword">in workspace:") sciencedirect_files = [] "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") "keyword">if &#x27;sciencedirect_alternative' "keyword">in file "keyword">and file.endswith('.txt'): sciencedirect_files.append(file) print(f"\nFound {len(sciencedirect_files)} ScienceDirect content files to analyze:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in sciencedirect_files: print(f" - {file}") print("\n=== DETAILED CONTENT ANALYSIS FOR REFERENCE WORKS INFORMATION ===\n") # Analyze each downloaded ScienceDirect file "keyword">in detail analysis_results = [] "keyword">for i, filename "keyword">in enumerate(sciencedirect_files, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) print(f"Analyzing {i}. {filename}") "keyword">with open(filepath, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() print(f"Content length: {len(content):,} characters") # Extract header information lines = content.split(&#x27;\n') header_info = {} "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines[:10]: "keyword">if line.startswith(&#x27;Source:'): header_info[&#x27;source'] = line.replace('Source:', '').strip() "keyword">elif line.startswith(&#x27;URL:'): header_info[&#x27;url'] = line.replace('URL:', '').strip() "keyword">elif line.startswith(&#x27;Final URL:'): header_info[&#x27;final_url'] = line.replace('Final URL:', '').strip() print(f"Source: {header_info.get(&#x27;source', 'Unknown')}") print(f"Original URL: {header_info.get(&#x27;url', 'Unknown')}") print(f"Final URL: {header_info.get(&#x27;final_url', 'Unknown')}") # Extract main content after header content_start_marker = "=" * 50 "keyword">if content_start_marker "keyword">in content: main_content = content[content.find(content_start_marker) + len(content_start_marker):] "keyword">else: main_content = content[500:] # Skip header info print(f"Main content length: {len(main_content):,} characters") # Convert to lowercase "keyword">for analysis content_lower = main_content.lower() print(f"\n--- Comprehensive Reference Works Search ---") # Expanded patterns "keyword">for Reference Works "keyword">and related content reference_patterns = [ r&#x27;reference\s+works?', r&#x27;reference\s+book', r&#x27;reference\s+collection', r&#x27;handbook', r&#x27;encyclopedia', r&#x27;comprehensive\s+reference', r&#x27;reference\s+module', r&#x27;reference\s+series', r&#x27;multi-volume\s+reference', r&#x27;reference\s+publication' ] reference_matches = {} total_reference_indicators = 0 "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in reference_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, content_lower) "keyword">if matches: reference_matches[pattern] = len(matches) total_reference_indicators += len(matches) print(f"Reference Works patterns found:") "keyword">for pattern, count "keyword">in reference_matches.items(): print(f" {pattern}: {count} occurrences") print(f"Total reference indicators: {total_reference_indicators}") # Look "keyword">for subject area classifications print(f"\n--- Subject Area Analysis ---") life_science_terms = [ &#x27;life sciences', 'life science', 'biology', 'biochemistry', 'biophysics', &#x27;molecular biology', 'cell biology', 'genetics', 'genomics', 'proteomics', &#x27;biotechnology', 'microbiology', 'ecology', 'evolution', 'botany', &#x27;zoology', 'marine biology', 'environmental science' ] health_science_terms = [ &#x27;health sciences', 'health science', 'medicine', 'medical', 'clinical', &#x27;pharmacology', 'pharmacy', 'nursing', 'public health', 'epidemiology', &#x27;immunology', 'pathology', 'physiology', 'anatomy', 'neuroscience', &#x27;cardiology', 'oncology', 'psychiatry', 'radiology', 'surgery' ] life_science_counts = {} health_science_counts = {} "keyword">for term "keyword">in life_science_terms: count = content_lower.count(term) "keyword">if count > 0: life_science_counts[term] = count "keyword">for term "keyword">in health_science_terms: count = content_lower.count(term) "keyword">if count > 0: health_science_counts[term] = count print(f"Life Science terms found: {life_science_counts}") print(f"Health Science terms found: {health_science_counts}") # Look "keyword">for publication statistics "keyword">or counts print(f"\n--- Publication Statistics Search ---") # Patterns that might indicate publication counts count_patterns = [ r&#x27;(\d{1,5})\s+(?:books?|titles?|volumes?|publications?)', r&#x27;(\d{1,5})\s+(?:reference\s+works?|handbooks?|encyclopedias?)', r&#x27;over\s+(\d{1,5})\s+(?:books?|titles?|publications?)', r&#x27;more\s+than\s+(\d{1,5})\s+(?:books?|titles?)', r&#x27;(\d{1,5})\s+(?:scientific|academic)\s+(?:books?|publications?)', r&#x27;collection\s+of\s+(\d{1,5})\s+(?:books?|titles?)', r&#x27;(\d{1,5})\s+(?:journals?\s+"keyword">and\s+books?|books?\s+"keyword">and\s+journals?)' ] found_counts = [] count_details = {} "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in count_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, content_lower) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: "keyword">if match.isdigit(): count = int(match) "keyword">if 10 <= count <= 50000: # Reasonable range "keyword">for publication counts found_counts.append(count) "keyword">if pattern "keyword">not "keyword">in count_details: count_details[pattern] = [] count_details[pattern].append(count) print(f"Publication counts found: {sorted(set(found_counts))}") "keyword">for pattern, counts "keyword">in count_details.items(): print(f" {pattern}: {counts}") # Look "keyword">for 2022 "keyword">or recent year mentions print(f"\n--- Year "keyword">and Date Analysis ---") year_patterns = [ r&#x27;2022', r'2021', r'2023', r'2020', r&#x27;"keyword">as\s+of\s+\d{4}', r&#x27;published\s+"keyword">in\s+\d{4}', r&#x27;updated\s+\d{4}' ] year_mentions = {} "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, content_lower) "keyword">if matches: year_mentions[pattern] = len(matches) print(f"Year mentions: {year_mentions}") # Look "keyword">for browse/navigation structure that might lead to more detailed data print(f"\n--- Navigation "keyword">and Structure Analysis ---") navigation_patterns = [ r&#x27;browse\s+by\s+subject', r&#x27;subject\s+areas?', r&#x27;browse\s+(?:books?|journals?)', r&#x27;filter\s+by', r&#x27;search\s+results?', r&#x27;view\s+all', r&#x27;show\s+more', r&#x27;categories?', r&#x27;disciplines?' ] navigation_found = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in navigation_patterns: "keyword">if re.search(pattern, content_lower): navigation_found.append(pattern.replace(&#x27;\\s+', ' ')) print(f"Navigation elements found: {navigation_found}") # Show relevant content samples print(f"\n--- Content Samples ---") # Find sections mentioning reference, books, "keyword">or publications reference_contexts = [] words = main_content.split() "keyword">for i, word "keyword">in enumerate(words): "keyword">if any(term "keyword">in word.lower() "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;reference', 'book', 'handbook', 'encyclopedia']): start = max(0, i-10) end = min(len(words), i+10) context = &#x27; '.join(words[start:end]) reference_contexts.append(context) # Show first few contexts "keyword">for j, context "keyword">in enumerate(reference_contexts[:3]): print(f"Context {j+1}: {context}") # Save detailed analysis "keyword">for this file file_analysis = { &#x27;filename': filename, &#x27;source': header_info.get('source', 'Unknown'), &#x27;original_url': header_info.get('url', 'Unknown'), &#x27;final_url': header_info.get('final_url', 'Unknown'), &#x27;content_length': len(content), &#x27;main_content_length': len(main_content), &#x27;reference_patterns': reference_matches, &#x27;total_reference_indicators': total_reference_indicators, &#x27;life_science_terms': life_science_counts, &#x27;health_science_terms': health_science_counts, &#x27;publication_counts': sorted(set(found_counts)), &#x27;count_details': count_details, &#x27;year_mentions': year_mentions, &#x27;navigation_elements': navigation_found, &#x27;reference_contexts': reference_contexts[:5] # Save first 5 contexts } analysis_results.append(file_analysis) print("=" * 80) # Comprehensive analysis across all files print(f"\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS ACROSS ALL SCIENCEDIRECT FILES ===\n") all_reference_indicators = 0 all_publication_counts = [] all_life_science_terms = {} all_health_science_terms = {} all_navigation_elements = [] "keyword">for result "keyword">in analysis_results: all_reference_indicators += result[&#x27;total_reference_indicators'] all_publication_counts.extend(result[&#x27;publication_counts']) # Combine life science terms "keyword">for term, count "keyword">in result[&#x27;life_science_terms'].items(): all_life_science_terms[term] = all_life_science_terms.get(term, 0) + count # Combine health science terms "keyword">for term, count "keyword">in result[&#x27;health_science_terms'].items(): all_health_science_terms[term] = all_health_science_terms.get(term, 0) + count all_navigation_elements.extend(result[&#x27;navigation_elements']) print(f"Files analyzed: {len(analysis_results)}") print(f"Total reference indicators across all files: {all_reference_indicators}") print(f"All publication counts found: {sorted(set(all_publication_counts))}") print(f"Life Science terms (combined): {dict(sorted(all_life_science_terms.items(), key="keyword">lambda x: x[1], reverse="keyword">True))}") print(f"Health Science terms (combined): {dict(sorted(all_health_science_terms.items(), key="keyword">lambda x: x[1], reverse="keyword">True))}") print(f"Navigation elements found: {list(set(all_navigation_elements))}") # Determine "keyword">if we found useful Reference Works data print(f"\n=== ASSESSMENT OF REFERENCE WORKS DATA AVAILABILITY ===\n") "keyword">if all_reference_indicators > 0: print(f"✓ Found {all_reference_indicators} reference-related indicators") "keyword">else: print(f"✗ No specific reference works indicators found") "keyword">if all_publication_counts: print(f"✓ Found publication counts: {sorted(set(all_publication_counts))}") print(f" Largest count: {max(all_publication_counts)}") print(f" Most frequent counts: {sorted(set(all_publication_counts))}") "keyword">else: print(f"✗ No publication counts found") "keyword">if all_life_science_terms "keyword">or all_health_science_terms: print(f"✓ Found subject area terms indicating Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences content") total_life_mentions = sum(all_life_science_terms.values()) total_health_mentions = sum(all_health_science_terms.values()) print(f" Total Life Sciences mentions: {total_life_mentions}") print(f" Total Health Sciences mentions: {total_health_mentions}") "keyword">else: print(f"✗ Limited subject area information found") # Final assessment "keyword">and recommendations print(f"\n=== FINAL ASSESSMENT AND RECOMMENDATIONS ===\n") "keyword">if all_publication_counts "keyword">and (all_life_science_terms "keyword">or all_health_science_terms): # We found some relevant data highest_count = max(all_publication_counts) print(f"🎯 PARTIAL SUCCESS: Found publication data "keyword">from ScienceDirect") print(f" Highest publication count found: {highest_count}") print(f" Subject areas confirmed: Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences present") print(f" Limitation: Specific &#x27;Reference Works' classification "keyword">not clearly identified") print(f" Interpretation: The {highest_count} may represent total books/publications including Reference Works") "keyword">elif all_navigation_elements: print(f"📍 NAVIGATION FOUND: ScienceDirect structure identified") print(f" Navigation elements: {list(set(all_navigation_elements))}") print(f" Recommendation: Use navigation to access more specific Reference Works sections") "keyword">else: print(f"⚠️ LIMITED DATA: Downloaded content lacks specific Reference Works statistics") print(f" Possible reasons:") print(f" 1. ScienceDirect may require authentication to view detailed statistics") print(f" 2. Reference Works data may be "keyword">in different sections "keyword">not yet accessed") print(f" 3. Data may be presented "keyword">in JavaScript-rendered content "keyword">not captured") print(f"\n=== ALTERNATIVE DATA SOURCE RECOMMENDATIONS ===\n") print(f"Since specific Reference Works counts are "keyword">not clearly available "keyword">from the accessed pages:") print(f"1. Search "keyword">for Elsevier annual reports "keyword">or ScienceDirect statistics publications") print(f"2. Look "keyword">for academic library databases that catalog Reference Works by publisher") print(f"3. Search "keyword">for bibliometric studies on Reference Works "keyword">in Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences") print(f"4. Contact Elsevier directly "keyword">for Reference Works publication statistics") print(f"5. Use alternative academic databases (Web of Science, Scopus) that may have this data") # Save comprehensive final analysis final_comprehensive_analysis = { &#x27;analysis_date': '2025-01-06', &#x27;method': 'Detailed content analysis of downloaded ScienceDirect pages', &#x27;files_analyzed': len(analysis_results), &#x27;total_reference_indicators': all_reference_indicators, &#x27;publication_counts_found': sorted(set(all_publication_counts)), &#x27;life_science_terms_total': sum(all_life_science_terms.values()), &#x27;health_science_terms_total': sum(all_health_science_terms.values()), &#x27;navigation_elements': list(set(all_navigation_elements)), &#x27;file_details': analysis_results, &#x27;assessment': { &#x27;reference_works_data_found': all_reference_indicators > 0, &#x27;publication_counts_available': len(all_publication_counts) > 0, &#x27;subject_areas_confirmed': len(all_life_science_terms) > 0 "keyword">or len(all_health_science_terms) > 0, &#x27;highest_publication_count': max(all_publication_counts) "keyword">if all_publication_counts "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;data_completeness': 'Partial' "keyword">if all_publication_counts "keyword">else 'Limited' }, &#x27;recommendations': [ &#x27;Search Elsevier annual reports "keyword">for Reference Works statistics', &#x27;Use academic databases "keyword">for Reference Works cataloging', &#x27;Contact publisher directly "keyword">for specific data', &#x27;Try bibliometric databases "keyword">for Reference Works analysis' ] } final_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;sciencedirect_reference_works_detailed_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(final_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_comprehensive_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\nDetailed analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(final_file)}") print(f"\nWorkspace files:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): "keyword">if &#x27;sciencedirect' "keyword">in file: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")
📄 Output

Use alternative academic databases (Web of Science, Scopus) that may have this data Detailed analysis saved to: sciencedirect_reference_works_detailed_analysis.json Workspace files: - sciencedirect_alternative_1_ScienceDirect_Main_Page.txt (6,571 bytes) -
